intro: Eriocephalus merxmuelleri, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Eriocephalus merxmuelleri is adapted to Mediterranean climates and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
